TopicTitle: CKAN (The Comprehensive Kerbal Archive Network); v1.28.0 - Dyson

Articles.Content:
18 minutes ago, Tyko said:

@HebaruSan with the latest update CKAN is no longer recognizing the current Kopernicus build as compatible with a clean install of 1.7.3

Thanks for maintaining this mod. If you need any other info let me know. 

Kopernicus depends on ModularFlightIntegrator, which is only supported up to KSP 1.6.

https://github.com/KSP-CKAN/CKAN/wiki/User-guide#choosing-compatible-game-versions

BUGREPORT CKAN v1.26.4   KSP v.1.7.3

Trying to install NearFuture mods group on my portable KSP 1.7.3 installation i've broke something in my local CKAN repository. Thereafter at the end of the installation of any mod i get this message with option to continue which freezes app and option quit.

Spoiler

just-in-time (JIT) debugging instead of this dialog box.

https://drive.google.com/open?id=1U4cNsWCQtuzEiebkdG6RbPtvftvyalAe

How can i manually fix my rep?

Edited August 27, 2019 by Ivan Pomidorov

1 hour ago, Ivan Pomidorov said:

How can i manually fix my rep?

Try clearing the cache size limit, that's the code that's crashing:

10 hours ago, HebaruSan said:

Kopernicus depends on ModularFlightIntegrator, which is only supported up to KSP 1.6.

https://github.com/KSP-CKAN/CKAN/wiki/User-guide#choosing-compatible-game-versions

For reference it operates fine on 1.7.3 but that is obviously not official.

Hey there.

The Global Construction (previously Ground Construction) mod doesn't display when KSP compatible version are selected as 1.6 (installing to game version 1.6.1.2401). Allista says all the components should be valid from 1.6.1 to 1.7.2 

Can this be rectified, as it makes it difficult to install MKS into 1.6.1 without the dependency chain being available

Thanks

Edited August 27, 2019 by strudo76
Now called Global Contruction

14 minutes ago, strudo76 said:

The Global Construction (previously Ground Construction) mod doesn't display when KSP compatible version are selected as 1.6 (installing to game version 1.6.1.2401). Allista says all the components should be valid from 1.6.1 to 1.7.2 

Can this be rectified, as it makes it difficult to install MKS into 1.6.1 without the dependency chain being available

That mod is set up to host its metadata on @allista's own repository. Submitted to help him fix that:  https://github.com/allista/GroundConstruction/pull/58

Hi, finding CKAN really useful and good for getting my game and all the mods up and running smoothly.

One suggestion, if I might, would be to add a "date added" or "released on" column. That way i could sort for new mods available and then follow the links to research them.

Anyway thanks for keeping it maintained - SJ

2 hours ago, serjames said:

One suggestion, if I might, would be to add a "date added" or "released on" column. That way i could sort for new mods available and then follow the links to research them.

Thanks for adding one more link I can use to prove this is "in demand".

https://github.com/KSP-CKAN/NetKAN-Infra/issues/6   https://github.com/KSP-CKAN/CKAN/issues/1155
possible to add tags to CKAN listing? like Graphics - MOD - Sound - Planet - Parts? Many new eyes on the game, would help them find their legs.

5 minutes ago, zer0Kerbal said:

possible to add tags to CKAN listing? like Graphics - MOD - Sound - Planet - Parts? Many new eyes on the game, would help them find their legs.

There's a syntax for it in the metadata but no user-visible usage of it yet:

https://github.com/KSP-CKAN/CKAN/wiki/Suggested-Tags

Edited September 14, 2019 by Smart Parts Wanter
I would love it if the "Launch KSP" button disabled itself after clicking it for 5-10 seconds

On 9/23/2019 at 9:50 AM, SteveD80 said:

I would love it if the "Launch KSP" button disabled itself after clicking it for 5-10 seconds

Yeah, it would be nice if Squad could bump the priority of the splash screen display.

The latest version gives me nothing but problems.

 

Clicking checkboxes just makes the program unresponsive for like 15 seconds (hitting 'update all' when there's a lot to update locks it up for like 5 minutes).

During mass updates/downloads I constantly get showered with stupid meaningless errors like this: 

System.Net.WebException: An exception occurred during a WebClient request. ---> System.IO.IOException: Received an unexpected EOF or 0 bytes from the transport stream.
   at System.Net.ConnectStream.EndRead(IAsyncResult asyncResult)
   at System.Net.WebClient.DownloadBitsReadCallbackState(DownloadBitsState state, IAsyncResult result)
   --- End of inner exception stack trace ---

Then when the downloads are about finished, I get crap like this: 

One or more downloads were unsuccessful:

Error downloading CryoEngines 1:1.0.3: Received an unexpected EOF or 0 bytes from the transport stream.
Error downloading KerbalAtomics 1:1.0.5: Received an unexpected EOF or 0 bytes from the transport stream.
Error downloading NearFutureLaunchVehicles 1.2.3: Unable to read data from the transport connection: The connection was closed.

And the installation says 'failed' and I have to start all over, frequently having to re-download several files.

This literally never ever happened under previous versions. This now is a total mess.

Edited September 28, 2019 by Frostiken

13 minutes ago, Frostiken said:

Clicking checkboxes just makes the program unresponsive for like 15 seconds (hitting 'update all' when there's a lot to update locks it up for like 5 minutes).

That's probably this issue: https://github.com/KSP-CKAN/CKAN/issues/2846

There's a test build with a fix here if you want to try it: https://github.com/KSP-CKAN/CKAN/pull/2855

Hmm, haven't seen that before. Is it possible you were trying this while SpaceDock was down?
How do i install .ckan files ?

14 minutes ago, Commodoregamer118 said:

How do i install .ckan files ?

In CKAN, File > Install from .ckan...?

36 minutes ago, Commodoregamer118 said:

How do i install .ckan files ?

That's not what you need, though. You probably just need to mark KSP 1.6 as compatible, because AirplanePlus isn't supported on 1.7 yet.

https://github.com/KSP-CKAN/CKAN/wiki/User-guide#choosing-compatible-game-versions

59 minutes ago, HebaruSan said:

That's not what you need, though. You probably just need to mark KSP 1.6 as compatible, because AirplanePlus isn't supported on 1.7 yet.

https://github.com/KSP-CKAN/CKAN/wiki/User-guide#choosing-compatible-game-versions

Wow...just how in the world did you divine that from his post?  Wait...I'm thinking of something...can you read my mind too??
